# Pull Request

## Description

Please include a summary of the changes and which issue is fixed. Include relevant motivation and context.

Fixes # (issue)

## Type of Change

Please delete options that are not relevant.

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Code refactoring
- [ ] Performance improvement
- [ ] Test addition/update
- [ ] Configuration change

## How Has This Been Tested?

Please describe the tests you ran to verify your changes. Provide instructions so we can reproduce.

- [ ] Test A
- [ ] Test B

- Node.js version:

- Connection method (Telnet/WebSocket/Web):

## Checklist

### Code Quality

- [ ] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have checked my code builds successfully (`npm run build`)

### Testing

- [ ] I have tested my changes manually
- [ ] I have tested both Telnet and WebSocket connections (if applicable)
- [ ] I have tested as both user and admin (if applicable)
- [ ] I have tested edge cases and error conditions

### Documentation

- [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly
- [ ] I have updated CONTRIBUTING.md (if workflow changed)
- [ ] I have updated docs/commands.md (if commands changed)
- [ ] I have updated docs/architecture.md (if architecture changed)
- [ ] I have updated relevant inline code comments

### Security

- [ ] My changes do not introduce security vulnerabilities
- [ ] I have validated and sanitized all user inputs
- [ ] I have not hardcoded any secrets or credentials
- [ ] I have reviewed the SECURITY.md policy

Add screenshots to help explain your changes.

## Breaking Changes

List any breaking changes and migration steps required.

Add any other context about the pull request here.

## Reviewer Notes

Any specific areas you'd like reviewers to focus on?
